members.name: setDefaultLightWeightPopupEnabled
members.comment: Sets the default value of the lightWeightPopupEnabled property.

param: aFlag - true if popups can be lightweight, otherwise false

members.name: getDefaultLightWeightPopupEnabled
members.comment: Gets the defaultLightWeightPopupEnabled property, which by default is true.

members.name: getUI
members.comment: Returns the look and feel (L&F) object that renders this component.

return: the PopupMenuUI object that renders this component

members.name: setUI
members.comment: Sets the L&F object that renders this component.

values.name: escription
values.value: The UI object that implements the Component's LookAndFeel.

param: ui - the new PopupMenuUI L&F object

members.name: updateUI
members.comment: Resets the UI property to a value from the current look and feel.

members.name: getUIClassID
members.comment: Returns the name of the L&F class that renders this component.

members.name: processKeyEvent
members.comment: Processes key stroke events such as mnemonics and accelerators.

see: KeyEvent, KeyListener, KeyboardFocusManager, DefaultKeyboardFocusManager, Component.processEvent(java.awt.AWTEvent), Component.dispatchEvent(java.awt.AWTEvent), Component.addKeyListener(java.awt.event.KeyListener), Component.enableEvents(long), Component.isShowing()
param: evt - the key event to be processed

members.name: getSelectionModel
members.comment: Returns the model object that handles single selections.

members.name: setSelectionModel
members.comment: Sets the model object to handle single selections.

values.name: escription
values.value: The selection model for the popup menu

param: model - the new SingleSelectionModel

members.name: add
members.comment: Appends the specified menu item to the end of this menu.

param: menuItem - the JMenuItem to add

members.name: add
members.comment: Creates a new menu item with the specified text and appends it to the end of this menu.

param: s - the string for the menu item to be added

members.name: add
members.comment: Appends a new menu item to the end of the menu which dispatches the specified Action object.

param: a - the Action to add to the menu

members.name: createActionComponent
members.comment: Factory method which creates the JMenuItem for Actions added to the JPopupMenu.

param: a - the Action for the menu item to be added

members.name: createActionChangeListener
members.comment: Returns a properly configured PropertyChangeListener which updates the control as changes to the Action occur.

param: b - the menu item for which to create a listener

members.name: remove
members.comment: Removes the component at the specified index from this popup menu.

param: pos - the position of the item to be removed
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if the value of pos < 0, or if the value of pos is greater than the number of items

members.name: setLightWeightPopupEnabled
members.comment: Sets the value of the lightWeightPopupEnabled property, which by default is true. By default, when a look and feel displays a popup, it can choose to use a lightweight (all-Java) popup. Lightweight popup windows are more efficient than heavyweight (native peer) windows, but lightweight and heavyweight components do not mix well in a GUI. If your application mixes lightweight and heavyweight components, you should disable lightweight popups. Some look and feels might always use heavyweight popups, no matter what the value of this property.

values.name: escription
values.value: Determines whether lightweight popups are used when possible

param: aFlag - false to disable lightweight popups

members.name: isLightWeightPopupEnabled
members.comment: Gets the lightWeightPopupEnabled property.

members.name: getLabel
members.comment: Returns the popup menu's label

return: a string containing the popup menu's label

members.name: setLabel
members.comment: Sets the popup menu's label. Different look and feels may choose to display or not display this.

values.name: escription
values.value: The label for the popup menu.

param: label - a string specifying the label for the popup menu

members.name: addSeparator
members.comment: Appends a new separator at the end of the menu.

members.name: insert
members.comment: Inserts a menu item for the specified Action object at a given position.

param: a - the Action object to insert
index - specifies the position at which to insert the Action, where 0 is the first

members.name: insert
members.comment: Inserts the specified component into the menu at a given position.

param: component - the Component to insert
index - specifies the position at which to insert the component, where 0 is the first

members.name: addPopupMenuListener
members.comment: Adds a PopupMenu listener.

param: l - the PopupMenuListener to add

members.name: removePopupMenuListener
members.comment: Removes a PopupMenu listener.

param: l - the PopupMenuListener to remove

members.name: getPopupMenuListeners
members.comment: Returns an array of all the PopupMenuListeners added to this JMenuItem with addPopupMenuListener().

return: all of the PopupMenuListeners added or an empty array if no listeners have been added

members.name: addMenuKeyListener
members.comment: Adds a MenuKeyListener to the popup menu.

param: l - the MenuKeyListener to be added

members.name: removeMenuKeyListener
members.comment: Removes a MenuKeyListener from the popup menu.

param: l - the MenuKeyListener to be removed

members.name: getMenuKeyListeners
members.comment: Returns an array of all the MenuKeyListeners added to this JPopupMenu with addMenuKeyListener().

return: all of the MenuKeyListeners added or an empty array if no listeners have been added

members.name: firePopupMenuWillBecomeVisible
members.comment: Notifies PopupMenuListeners that this popup menu will become visible.

members.name: firePopupMenuWillBecomeInvisible
members.comment: Notifies PopupMenuListeners that this popup menu will become invisible.

members.name: firePopupMenuCanceled
members.comment: Notifies PopupMenuListeners that this popup menu is cancelled.

members.name: pack
members.comment: Lays out the container so that it uses the minimum space needed to display its contents.

members.name: setVisible
members.comment: Sets the visibility of the popup menu.

param: b - true to make the popup visible, or false to hide it

members.name: isVisible
members.comment: Returns true if the popup menu is visible (currently being displayed).

return: true if the component is visible, false otherwise

members.name: setLocation
members.comment: Sets the location of the upper left corner of the popup menu using x, y coordinates. The method changes the geometry-related data. Therefore, the native windowing system may ignore such requests, or it may modify the requested data, so that the JPopupMenu object is placed and sized in a way that corresponds closely to the desktop settings.

values.name: escription
values.value: The location of the popup menu.

param: x - the x coordinate of the popup's new position in the screen's coordinate space
y - the y coordinate of the popup's new position in the screen's coordinate space

members.name: getInvoker
members.comment: Returns the component which is the 'invoker' of this popup menu.

return: the Component in which the popup menu is displayed

members.name: setInvoker
members.comment: Sets the invoker of this popup menu -- the component in which the popup menu menu is to be displayed.

values.name: escription
values.value: The invoking component for the popup menu

param: invoker - the Component in which the popup menu is displayed

members.name: show
members.comment: Displays the popup menu at the position x,y in the coordinate space of the component invoker.

param: invoker - the component in whose space the popup menu is to appear
x - the x coordinate in invoker's coordinate space at which the popup menu is to be displayed
y - the y coordinate in invoker's coordinate space at which the popup menu is to be displayed

members.name: getComponentAtIndex
members.comment: Returns the component at the specified index.

param: i - the index of the component, where 0 is the first

members.name: getComponentIndex
members.comment: Returns the index of the specified component.

param: c - the Component to find
return: the index of the component, where 0 is the first; or -1 if the component is not found

members.name: setPopupSize
members.comment: Sets the size of the Popup window using a Dimension object. This is equivalent to setPreferredSize(d).

values.name: escription
values.value: The size of the popup menu

param: d - the Dimension specifying the new size of this component.

members.name: setPopupSize
members.comment: Sets the size of the Popup window to the specified width and height. This is equivalent to setPreferredSize(new Dimension(width, height)).

values.name: escription
values.value: The size of the popup menu

param: width - the new width of the Popup in pixels
height - the new height of the Popup in pixels

members.name: setSelected
members.comment: Sets the currently selected component, This will result in a change to the selection model.

values.name: escription
values.value: The selected component on the popup menu

param: sel - the Component to select

members.name: isBorderPainted
members.comment: Checks whether the border should be painted.

return: true if the border is painted, false otherwise

members.name: setBorderPainted
members.comment: Sets whether the border should be painted.

values.name: escription
values.value: Is the border of the popup menu painted

param: b - if true, the border is painted.

members.name: paintBorder
members.comment: Paints the popup menu's border if the borderPainted property is true.

param: g - the Graphics object

members.name: getMargin
members.comment: Returns the margin, in pixels, between the popup menu's border and its containers.

return: an Insets object containing the margin values.

members.name: paramString
members.comment: Returns a string representation of this JPopupMenu. This method is intended to be used only for debugging purposes, and the content and format of the returned string may vary between implementations. The returned string may be empty but may not be null.

members.name: getAccessibleContext
members.comment: Gets the AccessibleContext associated with this JPopupMenu. For JPopupMenus, the AccessibleContext takes the form of an AccessibleJPopupMenu. A new AccessibleJPopupMenu instance is created if necessary.

return: an AccessibleJPopupMenu that serves as the AccessibleContext of this JPopupMenu

members.name: processMouseEvent
members.comment: This method is required to conform to the MenuElement interface, but it not implemented.

param: event - a MouseEvent to be processed
path - the path of the receiving element in the menu hierarchy
manager - the MenuSelectionManager for the menu hierarchy

members.name: processKeyEvent
members.comment: Processes a key event forwarded from the MenuSelectionManager and changes the menu selection, if necessary, by using MenuSelectionManager's API. Note: you do not have to forward the event to sub-components. This is done automatically by the MenuSelectionManager.

param: e - a KeyEvent
path - the MenuElement path array
manager - the MenuSelectionManager

members.name: menuSelectionChanged
members.comment: Messaged when the menubar selection changes to activate or deactivate this menu. This implements the javax.swing.MenuElement interface. Overrides MenuElement.menuSelectionChanged.

param: isIncluded - true if this menu is active, false if it is not

members.name: getSubElements
members.comment: Returns an array of MenuElements containing the submenu for this menu component. It will only return items conforming to the JMenuElement interface. If popup menu is null returns an empty array. This method is required to conform to the MenuElement interface.

members.name: getComponent
members.comment: Returns this JPopupMenu component.

members.name: isPopupTrigger
members.comment: Returns true if the MouseEvent is considered a popup trigger by the JPopupMenu's currently installed UI.

param: e - a MouseEvent
return: true if the mouse event is a popup trigger

members.comment: Constructs a JPopupMenu without an "invoker".
Constructs a JPopupMenu with the specified title.

param: label - the string that a UI may use to display as a title for the popup menu.

values.name: escription
values.value: A small window that pops up and displays a series of choices.
